responses: You might have a common cold. Stay hydrated and rest.
You may have influenza (flu). Consider consulting a doctor.
You might have COVID-19. Please isolate yourself and get tested.
You may have symptoms of diabetes. A blood sugar test is recommended.
You may have hypertension (high blood pressure). Consult a doctor for evaluation.
You may have asthma. Consider seeing a pulmonologist.
You might have pneumonia. Please consult a healthcare professional immediately.
You may be experiencing a migraine. Rest in a dark room and consider over-the-counter pain relief.
You might have malaria. Seek medical attention for confirmation and treatment.
You may have dengue fever. Visit a doctor for proper diagnosis and treatment.
You may have anemia. A blood test is recommended.
You might have tuberculosis. Consult a doctor immediately for tests and treatment.
You may have allergies. Avoid allergens and consider antihistamines.
You may have symptoms of heart disease. Seek immediate medical advice.
You may have appendicitis. Immediate medical attention is required.
You might have acid reflux or GERD. Avoid spicy foods and consult a doctor if it persists.
You may have arthritis. Consider consulting a rheumatologist for proper diagnosis.
You might be experiencing depression. Reach out to a mental health professional for support.
You may have hypothyroidism. A thyroid function test is recommended.
You might have hyperthyroidism. Consult an endocrinologist for further evaluation.
You might have cholera. Immediate hydration and medical care are essential.
You may have hepatitis. Please consult a doctor for appropriate tests and treatment.
You may have chickenpox. Rest and avoid scratching the rash to prevent infection.
You might have measles. Consult a healthcare provider for confirmation.
You may have meningitis. Seek emergency medical care immediately.
You might have kidney stones. Drink plenty of water and consult a urologist.
You may have eczema. Use moisturizers and consult a dermatologist.
You may have psoriasis. Consult a dermatologist for appropriate treatment.
You may have sinusitis. Steam inhalation might help, but consult a doctor for persistent symptoms.
You might have a stomach ulcer. Avoid spicy foods and consult a gastroenterologist.
You may have signs of skin cancer. Consult a dermatologist for an evaluation.
You may be experiencing a stroke. Seek emergency medical care immediately.
You might have symptoms of Parkinson's disease. Consult a neurologist for assessment.
You might have celiac disease. A gluten-free diet and medical consultation are recommended.
